definition: to blush/to turn red
surname Hong
red/popular/revolutionary/bonus
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
to play the role of the hero (idiom)/to play the good cop
(bird species of China) red-faced cormorant (Phalacrocorax urile)

sentences.english: Is this not of more consequence than a fat red-faced gentleman's sums?
sentences.chinese: 这难道不比那个大胖子红脸先生的帐目更重要？

sentences.english: I hate it when guys play weak and let the woman be the tough one.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌男孩子装软弱装无能，而让女孩子唱红脸。

sentences.english: The red-faced, merry soldier was still twitching convulsively ; but they did not carry him away.
sentences.chinese: 那个红脸的士兵还在抽搐，但没有人来抬他。

sentences.english: She often blushes when speaking to strangers.
He had a red face, grey eyes and a long black beard.
sentences.chinese: 他有一张红脸，灰色的眼睛和长长的黑胡子。

sentences.english: For instance, red for heroism, white for villainy .
sentences.chinese: 好比，红脸表英雄，白脸表反派。

sentences.english: If that didn’t work there was the ‘cummerbund’ to hide a paunch and - if you couldn’t even make it up the stairs without turning ‘crimson’ –they had the ‘bungalow’.
sentences.chinese: 如果你上台阶会红脸，他们有平房。

sentences.english: And reddening Phoebus lifts his golden fire.
sentences.chinese: 徒有红脸的菲勃斯高举金色的火。

definition: white face/face painting in Beijing opera etc
yellow face (due to sickness etc)/yellow-skinned people
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
facial contour/facial shape
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
self-respect of old person/face/thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism)/brazen
red in the face/extremely angry
flushed with anger (or excitement)
full beard
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
pockmarked face
to blush
rosacea (dermatological condition of the face and nose)/brandy nose
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
very red/red through and through/to blush (deep red)
lit. pale-faced scholar (idiom); young and inexperienced person without practical experience/still wet behind the ears
